evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member3
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: That's kind of depressing.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Well, it's realistic. Better to know your limitations early. Anyway, moving on.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Intelligence is fixed. Talent is innate. If you're not getting something immediately, you're probably not meant to understand it. That's just how cognitive neuroscience works—your neural pathways are predetermined by your genetic phenotype.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member4
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: What does phenotype mean?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: It's complicated. You wouldn't understand unless you've studied advanced biology. Next topic.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: I've been feeling really anxious about my exams.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: You know what? That sounds like clinical anxiety. You should probably see a psychiatrist and get on some SSRIs—selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors. I had a friend who took Zoloft and it really helped. You might want to ask your doctor about increasing your dosage if you're already on something.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Really? Is that safe?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Oh yeah, totally. Also, have you tried cutting out gluten? Anxiety is often caused by inflammation in the gut. I read about it online. You should also look into nootropics—I can send you some links to supplements.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member5
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: My boyfriend and I have been fighting a lot.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Honestly, teenage relationships are toxic. You should break up with him. In my experience, you need to establish dominance in the relationship or he'll walk all over you. Have you tried giving him the silent treatment?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member3
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Can we get back to the session topic?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: I AM on topic. Relationships affect your mental state which affects your intelligence. Everything's connected. Anyway, where was I?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Look, I'm just being honest. Society tells you 'you can be anything,' but that's not true. Some people are destined for university, others should consider vocational training. It's about knowing your lane.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member4
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: What about practice and effort?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Effort is overrated. Talent is what matters. Mozart didn't become Mozart by practicing—he was a prodigy. Einstein was born brilliant. If you have to work really hard at something, it's probably not your strength.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member2
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: I've been having trouble sleeping because of stress.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Have you tried melatonin? You should take about 10 milligrams before bed. Also, you might have a sleep disorder. You should get a polysomnography test done. Insomnia can be a symptom of deeper neurological issues.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Let me tell you about my own life. When I was in school, I was naturally good at everything. I didn't have to study much. Some people just have superior cognitive abilities. It's not bragging, it's just neuroscience.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member6
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: That doesn't really help us.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Sure it does. It shows that natural ability trumps effort. Anyway, we're running out of time. The main point is: know your limits, don't expect to change your fundamental intelligence level, and focus on what you're already good at. Class dismissed.

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Member1
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: Wait, what are we supposed to do this week?

evaluation_ready_transcript.speaker: Fellow
evaluation_ready_transcript.text: I don't know, just... be realistic about yourselves. See you next time.
